III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program Statement
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’
needs, implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of
residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A youth feels unsafe at the facility because a staff member is
bullying him. The staff member has stuck their tongue out,
laughed at the youth, and looked at the youth in a bad way.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on 2/7/25.
Youth A reported the first time he met Staff 1, they were sitting at
a table and Staff 1 said, “Why are you looking at me? What are
you looking at?”. Youth A replied, “How do you know I’m looking at
you?”. Youth A reported it happened a long time ago, and he
doesn’t remember who else was present, but the interaction
pushed him to be guarded against Staff 1. Youth A reported a
separate time, Staff 1 was leaving and stuck her tongue out at him
like she was mocking him. Youth A couldn’t remember if anyone
else was around. Youth A reported another time, there were three
staff present (Staff 1, Staff 5 and another staff he couldn’t
remember). Youth A reported he told Staff 5 he didn’t get along
with Staff 1 and he didn’t want her present, so she should go be
with the other youth instead. Youth A reported Staff 1 said, “I’m
going to be here whether you like it or not”. Another time, Youth A
reported he didn’t want to interact with Staff 1, and they weren’t
getting along at all. Youth A did not provide any other details.
Youth A reported there have been multiple situations, and he
wants to avoid any reports so he doesn’t get in trouble, so he
wanted to report this information before anything more could
happen. Youth A reported he feels like Staff 1 is provoking him, so
they keep butting heads with each other. Youth A reported he
would rather not be around her, so he can protect himself and
stop her from provoking him. Youth A reported no matter how
much he tries to stay away from her, she continues to try and be
around him to push his buttons. Youth A reported when Staff 1 is
around him, she says, “whether you want me around or not, I have
to be here”, so it’s clear Staff 1 doesn’t care what he thinks or how
he feels. Youth A reported Staff 1’s body language presents as
she is demeaning towards him. Youth A reported Staff 1 has
never insulted him with her words; it’s just her body language and
2

being around him when he has stated repeatedly, he doesn’t want
her around. Youth A reported he feels Staff 1 lacks respect
towards him and it’s causing problems for him he didn’t choose to
have. Youth A reported there haven’t been staff around to witness
all these situations, but all staff are aware he doesn’t want Staff 1
around him. Youth A reported he doesn’t want Staff 1 to get in
trouble, but he wants to set boundaries and wants to make sure
she doesn’t continue interacting with him in this way.
Youth B was unable to be interviewed. Youth B was discharged
from the facility in December 2024 and was discharged from the
Office of Refugee Resettlement (ORR) as well, due to turning 18
years old. The facility does not have any contact information for
Youth B or his current case manager.
Assistant Director (AD) was interviewed via phone on 2/4/25.
AD reported she did not have any information besides what was
listed in the allegations.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
2/7/25. Supervisor reported there have been no concerns
regarding Staff 1’s interactions with Youth A in any of her
performance reviews and Staff 1 has not had any disciplinary
actions or corrections related to her interactions with youth.
Supervisor reported there has been tension between Youth A and
Staff 1 for a while, but she’s not sure why the tension originated.
Supervisor reported the tension originated around September
2024, but Supervisor was on leave during that time, so she
learned about the tension when she returned.
Supervisor reported there was tension between Staff 1 and Youth
B as well. Supervisor reported Youth A and Youth B were very
good friends, so she believes some of Youth A’s tension with Staff
1 comes from Staff 1’s tense relationship with Youth B. Supervisor
reported Youth A and Youth B would be escalated separately and
then come together to brag about how escalated they each were
towards staff (not just towards Staff 1). Supervisor reported she
came back from leave at the beginning of October 2024 and
noticed Staff 1 and Youth A weren’t very connected. Supervisor
reported Youth A self-isolated from many staff and treated staff as
well as other youth poorly. Supervisor reported one time Youth A
went AWOL, and he only agreed to come back because they
informed him, he could be on the 3rd floor by himself with two staff
instead of being on the 2nd floor with everyone. Supervisor
reported Youth A was on the 3rd floor for 1-2 months and decided
to come back down to the 2nd floor a week ago. Supervisor
3

reported when Youth A was on the 3rd floor, he was assigned two
staff per shift daily, and the staff would rotate based on schedules.
Supervisor reported Staff 1 was a part of the rotation of staff
assigned. Supervisor reported despite Youth A’s requests, she
continued to assign staff Youth A didn’t like because she wanted
them to build rapport. Supervisor reported the only staff Youth A
continued not to like was Staff 1. Supervisor reported she learned
about the allegations because Youth A finished a phone call with a
child advocate, then asked Staff 4 to get Staff 2 because Staff 2
speaks French like Youth A. This occurred around 1/30/25. Youth
A told Staff 2, he wanted to speak with Supervisor, and she
happened to be on call. Supervisor reported she facetimed with
Youth A and Youth A reported he was tired of running, tired of
acting, wanted to do better, wanted to feel/be okay, and wanted to
go to school. Supervisor reported Youth A said the only request
he had was not to have Staff 1 assigned to him. Supervisor asked
Youth A why and Youth A said every time Staff 1 was assigned to
him, he would have a report written about him and he would get in
trouble. Youth A stated Staff 1 makes him feel uncomfortable
because she stuck her tongue out at him once and Staff 1 told
Youth A she was “tired of him”. Youth A told Supervisor he spoke
to Therapist about his concerns. Supervisor called Staff 1 and told
her she could switch out her future assignments to Youth A with
someone else. Supervisor called Therapist to update her, and
Therapist called Youth A to speak with him further. Supervisor
reported a few days later she spoke to Staff 1 to try and gauge
what happened between Staff 1 and Youth A from Staff 1’s
perspective. Staff 1 told Supervisor there was a lot of tension, and
they weren’t getting along with each other. Staff 1 said Youth A
would look at her up and down her body frequently and Youth A
made a comment about Staff 1’s daughter, which is where the
tension began and when Staff 1 began feeling uncomfortable.
Staff 1 said Youth A then cussed her out and they stopped talking
to each other. Staff 1 reported she has since attempted
communicating with Youth A, but Youth A hasn’t reciprocated
contact. Supervisor reported the most recent time Youth A went
AWOL (1/18/25), Staff 1, Staff 5 and Staff 7 were looking for him.
Supervisor reported after they found Youth A and Youth A went
into the van, Youth A made some kind of threat towards Staff 1
and Staff 1’s response (according to Staff 5) was “I’m not afraid of
you”. Supervisor reported she felt the immediate response was
not appropriate. Supervisor reported that’s the only concern any
staff have brought to her regarding Staff 1 and Youth A.
Supervisor reported she didn’t speak to Staff 1 about the specific
allegations but asked if Staff 1 recalled anything she might have
4

done to make Youth A feel uncomfortable. Supervisor reported
Staff 1 was very deflective, and said she didn’t do anything.
Supervisor asked Staff 1 to think about whether she ever had a
power struggle or argument with him and then provided Staff 1
with some guides and advice for how to handle those situations
(i.e. self-criticism from peers, power struggles, how to self-
regulate). Supervisor also reminded Staff 1 she was the adult in
the situation and explained Youth A’s trauma history. Supervisor
reported Staff 1 didn’t respond well and acted as though
Supervisor was judging her. Staff 1 said, “so you just want me to
act like a robot and show no emotion?”. Supervisor told her that’s
not what she expected, and requested Staff 1 have more patience
and understanding for Youth A, as well as put his past trauma into
perspective in her interactions with him. Supervisor reported she
didn’t feel like Staff 1 took the information well. Supervisor
reported she told Staff 1 she would check in with her on a regular
basis to continue to process the situation. Supervisor told Staff 1
although Youth A stated he didn’t want to interact with Staff 1,
Staff 1 could still be on the same area/floor as Youth A if Staff 1
did not speak with Youth A.
Therapist was interviewed face to face at the facility on
2/7/25. Therapist reported about a week and a half ago, she
asked Youth A how his relationships were with staff. Youth A
reported his relationships with staff are fine except for Staff 1.
Youth A reported Staff 1 is “no good”, “just likes to play games”,
and “pretends to be a good person, but is not a good person”.
Youth A reported Staff 1 has gotten him in trouble a lot. Youth A
did not provide any specific examples of what, why, how or when
any of these incidents occurred. Therapist reported she
encouraged Youth A to speak directly with staff if he has a
problem so they can work out what the issue is. Therapist
reported she didn’t hear anything else about it until these
allegations came up. Therapist reported she spoke with Youth A
and Youth A said Staff 1 stuck her tongue out at him when she
was leaving one time. Youth A also reported Staff 1 was “being
mean” to him but could not provide any examples of what he
meant. Youth A told Therapist the last time he ran away it was
because he didn’t want Staff 1 there. Youth A told Therapist Staff
1 said, “you’re not going to tell me what to do. Wherever you go,
and whatever you do, I’m going to be here no matter what”, which
he said felt combative. Youth A reported he became upset about
what Staff 1 said, which is why he went AWOL. Youth A reported
he ran up to a random guy on the street and asked to use the
guy’s phone, but Staff 1 came up and said, “he’s not in any
danger. There’s nothing to worry about”. Youth A reported he was
5

mad Staff 1 came up and intervened. Therapist reported she didn’t
feel like Youth A provided many details or examples for the claims
he is making. Therapist reported he could not provide timeframes,
who else was around when the incidents happened, etc. except
for the day he went AWOL. Therapist reported she has never
witnessed Youth A’s interactions with Staff 1.
Staff 1 was interviewed via phone on 2/24/25. Staff 1 reported
she began having tension with Youth A because she set
boundaries with him, and he didn’t like it. Staff 1 reported she felt
Youth A was sexually harassing her (i.e. body scanning her from
head to toe, looking too long at her chest, gawk at her for long
periods of time, told her she was pretty frequently, asked if she
had a daughter in college & said if her daughter looked like her, he
would marry her, etc.). Staff 1 reported after the comment about
her daughter, she put a firm boundary in place, and when she did
that, Youth A went to Supervisor and told Supervisor, Staff 1 was
being mean. Staff 1 explained to Supervisor why she put the
boundary in place and reported she felt uncomfortable due to
Youth A’s advances. Staff 1 explained Youth A has also
threatened her with violence, which she also reported to
Supervisor. Staff 1 reported from then on, she was scared for her
own safety and didn’t want anything bad on her record, so she put
some distance between her and Youth A and respected Youth A’s
space. Staff 1 reported she loves her job and will do anything to
ensure youth are comfortable, safe, and relaxed while waiting for
their case to be settled. Staff 1 reported she tried to make herself
invisible to Youth A, not provoke Youth A or not escalate Youth A.
Staff 1 reported she tried to avoid him as much as possible. For
example, Youth A did not like going on outings, so Staff 1 would
go on outings, so she wasn’t left behind with Youth A. Staff 1
reported if she was around Youth A, she would smile at him to be
nice, but Youth A would glare at her in return. Staff 1 reported she
heard from other staff Youth A hated her and didn’t want any
connection or bond with her, so she invested herself in creating
relationships with other youth instead. Staff 1 reported once Youth
A was on the 3rd floor and assigned two staff per shift daily, she
was assigned to go up there and she brought up concerns with
her assignment to Supervisor. Supervisor told her to continue with
the assignment to 3rd floor to repair her relationship with Youth A,
but when Staff 1 went there, Youth A rejected her. Staff 1 reported
she was then allowed to find someone to cover her assignment.
Staff 1 reported she had a lot of anxiety about being assigned to
supervise Youth A and expressed that to Supervisor. Staff 1
reported another time in January 2025, she was assigned to the
3rd floor with Youth A, and she brought her concerns to Supervisor
6

again. Youth A had already gone AWOL in the morning, so Staff 1
knew as soon as Youth A saw her, he would likely go AWOL
again because he had already said previously, he would not be in
any space Staff 1 was in. Staff 1 reported she was told to go to the
3rd floor anyway, so she did. Staff 1 reported as soon as she got to
the 3rd floor, Youth A said, “I don’t want you up here”. Staff 1
reported she responded stating, “I’m sorry, I’m just doing my job”,
and she repeated the same phrase every time he said he didn’t
want her there. Staff 1 reported Youth A went AWOL and told her
not to follow him. Staff 1 told Youth A it was her job, and she had
to follow him if he went AWOL. Staff 1 reported while Youth A was
AWOL, he went up to a random woman and her kids and asked to
use the woman’s phone. Staff 1 reported the woman looked
uncomfortable, so Staff 1 intervened, which Youth A was unhappy
about. Staff 1 reported when Youth A finally got into the staff van,
he said, “by the end of the day, something is going to happen to
you, I promise”. Staff 1 reported Staff 5 witnessed this interaction,
and Staff 1 reported this threat to Supervisor. Staff 1 reported
shortly after, she was once again assigned to Youth A on the 3rd
floor, so she spoke to Supervisor about her concerns again. Staff
1 reported she told Supervisor she was having a panic attack and
had a bad feeling about going up there because it would provoke
Staff 1. However, Supervisor told Staff 1 Youth A was having a
good week, and it would be a good time for her to try and repair a
bond with him, so she needed to proceed with her assignment.
Staff 1 reported Youth A was having a phone call downstairs, so
she went down and stood against a wall where Youth A couldn’t
see her. Staff 1 reported Youth A said he wanted to speak to a
staff who spoke his language, so Staff 2 came down. Staff 2 and
Youth A called Supervisor, and Youth A was yelling at Supervisor
over the phone. Staff 1 reported she hadn’t seen Youth A that day,
hadn’t spoken to him, hadn’t mentioned his name, etc., but Youth
A saw her downstairs and was very upset Staff 1 was assigned to
him again. Staff 1 reported she was then switched out with
another staff. Staff 1 reported she has never stuck her tongue out
at Youth A, never told him she’s tired of him, never purposely
sought him out to irritate him, done anything to bully him or said
anything to the extent of “poking the bear” when speaking about
him. Staff 1 reported her goal every day has been to avoid Youth
A so as not to provoke him or escalate him further.
Staff 2 was interviewed via phone on 2/10/25. Staff 2 reported
he has never noticed Staff 1 having inappropriate interactions with
any youth. Staff 2 reported there has been issues between Staff 1
and Youth A, which has caused them not to speak to each other.
Staff 2 reported Youth A had a crush on Staff 1 and Staff 1 told
7

Youth A to stop because it was inappropriate. Staff 2 reported
Staff 1 told him Youth A was mad at her for rejecting him. Staff 2
reported Youth A said he felt uncomfortable around Staff 1 and felt
like Staff 1 provoked him. Staff 2 reported one day, Youth A ran
away and Staff 1 as well as two other staff (unsure who) picked
Youth A up. Staff 2 reported Youth A told him when Staff 1 came
on the 3rd floor, Youth A told her he was going to run and Staff 1
said, “if you want to run, run, I’m ready to go after you”. Staff 2
reported Youth A said he felt like that was Staff 1 provoking him,
so he ended up running away. Staff 2 reported he has not seen
Staff 1 do anything towards Youth A to provoke him. Staff 2
reported he has never seen Staff 1 stick her tongue out at Youth
A, tell him she’s tired of him, or treat him bad in any way. Staff 2
reported towards the end of January, Youth A told Staff 2 he was
going to do something bad to Staff 1 if she ever talked to him
again, but Youth A didn’t specify what he meant. Staff 2 reported
he told Staff 1 the information and he believed Staff 1 told a
supervisor about it, but he isn’t sure who or if she did.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 2/7/25.
Staff 3 reported she has not witnessed any big incidents between
Staff 1 and Youth A. Staff 3 reported she feels Staff 1 lets her
emotions get in the way of the work they do at the facility. Staff 3
reported when Youth B was at the facility, he was frequently
escalated and frustrated with her. Youth B would yell at Staff 1
and tell her to stop talking to him. However, instead of walking
away, Staff 1 would match his energy, raise her voice and say, “I
don’t even talk to you”. Staff 3 reported one day Youth A was in a
conference room and staff were checking on him throughout the
time he was in there. Staff 3 reported Staff 1 came down and said,
“I really want to poke the bear, but I won’t” in reference to
interacting with Youth A. Staff 3 reported this incident happened
approximately 3 months ago, but Staff 1 never entered the room
or interacted with Youth A. Staff 3 reported another time Youth A
was getting ready to leave, and Staff 1 had her coat on and said,
“where are we going? Are we going on a walk?”. Youth A told
Staff 1 not to follow him, and Staff 1 said, “you’re not going to tell
me what to do. You’re not my boss.”. Staff 3 reported this
occurred about a month ago when Youth A went AWOL. Staff 3
reported she wasn’t present for this situation and didn’t hear
exactly what was said and didn’t see what happened, but Staff 1
told her what happened. Staff 3 reported she hasn’t witnessed any
other situations where Staff 1 has provoked Youth A, and in the
last two months she hasn’t worked with Staff 1 when they’ve been
around Youth A. Staff 3 reported Staff 1 has a playful personality.
Staff 3 gave an example that one time the youth were doing
8

homework, and Staff 1 pushed the youths’ papers on the floor, or
kicked the chairs they were sitting in. Staff 3 reported Staff 1’s
language is also sometimes not appropriate around the youth but
couldn’t provide any examples. Staff 3 reported she feels Staff 1 is
trying to be playful, not hurtful, but sometimes Staff 1’s
interactions come across as inappropriate.
Staff 4 was interviewed via phone on 2/10/25. Staff 4 reported
Youth A has never talked to her about Staff 1 or complained about
Staff 1. Staff 4 reported she has witnessed Staff 1 and Youth A
interact a few times. Staff 4 reported at the beginning, they
seemed to get along well, but the past few times she has seen
them interact, she’s noticed a level of discomfort from each of
them. Staff 4 reported she’s not sure what’s causing them to be
uncomfortable around each other. Staff 4 reported when Youth A
was on the 3rd floor, Staff 1 was scheduled to work a shift with
Staff 4 and Youth A stated he was not a fan of Staff 1, and if she
was going to be on the 3rd floor, he wasn’t going to be. Staff 4
reported the other couple times she has been scheduled to work
on the 3rd floor with Staff 1, Staff 1 has had to switch out with
another staff because Youth A doesn’t want Staff 1 there. Staff 4
reported Youth A has never explained why he doesn’t want Staff 1
there. Staff 4 reported the only thing she has ever heard Staff 1
say to Youth A in response is, “this is my job. I’m assigned to be
here, and I’m going to follow what my supervisors tell me to do”.
Staff 4 reported she never felt like Staff 1 said it to provoke Youth
A. In fact, Staff 4 reported she felt Staff 1 seemed nervous about
setting a boundary with Youth A when she said it. Staff 4 reported
she has never seen Staff 1 do or say anything that would be
considered bullying, provoking, or inappropriate towards Youth A
or any other youth.
Staff 5 was interviewed via phone on 2/24/25. Staff 5 reported
he has observed positive interactions between Staff 1 and the
youth at the facility. Staff 5 reported Staff 1 is a hard worker and is
always ready to work. Staff 5 reported sometimes Staff 1 will bend
the rules a bit to please youth, but never in an inappropriate or
unsafe way. For example, Staff 1 will sometimes let the youth play
music with bad words in it even though they’re not supposed to.
Staff 5 reported he hasn’t noticed any inappropriate interactions
between Staff 1 and Youth A. Staff 5 reported Staff 1 told him
Youth A was looking at her in a sexual way one day, and it made
her uncomfortable. Staff 5 reported he has not seen any bullying
behavior by Staff 1 towards Youth A. Staff 5 reported when Youth
A first arrived at the facility, he and Staff 1 got along well.
However, one night, Youth A wasn’t following the rules, and Staff
9

1 continued to enforce the rules. Youth A didn’t like Staff 1
enforcing the rules or telling him what to do, and there’s been
tension between them ever since. Staff 1 has told Staff 5 she is
not afraid of Youth A, but Staff 5 reported Staff 1 has not said that
directly to Youth A to his knowledge. Staff 5 reported in January
2025, Staff 5 entered the floor, and Staff 1 told him not to take off
his jacket because Youth A wanted to run away. Youth A was
getting ready to leave and said, “tell her not to follow me”, and
then walked off the floor. Staff 5 reported he asked Youth A later
why he went AWOL and Youth A said he wasn’t going to run
away, but Staff 1 provoked him, so he did. Staff 5 reported Youth
A would not provide details as to what Staff 1 did to provoke him.
Staff 5 reported he has never witnessed Staff 1 provoking Youth
A.
Staff 6 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 2/7/25.
Staff 6 reported Staff 1 has interacted professionally with the
youth, and he hasn’t witnessed anything odd or inappropriate in
her interactions with them. Staff 6 reported he has never seen or
heard about Staff 1 bullying Youth A, sticking her tongue out at
him, saying anything inappropriate to him, or treating him bad.
Staff 6 reported one-time Youth A was throwing things at Staff 1,
and it made her scared. Staff 6 reported at the next staff meeting,
Staff 1 cried and was very emotional about what happened. Staff
6 reported Youth A frequently had behaviors towards other youth
and staff (i.e. verbal abuse, cussing at them, not doing
chores/responsibilities). Staff 6 reported due to behaviors, Youth A
spent some time on the 3rd floor as the only youth and was always
assigned two staff. Staff 6 reported within the last week, Youth A
has moved back down to the 2nd floor and his behaviors have
improved greatly.
Staff 7 was interviewed via phone on 2/10/25. Staff 7 reported
she has witnessed interactions between Youth A and Staff 1 a
couple times. Staff 7 reported Staff 1 is outspoken, but never
aggressive. Staff 7 reported she is not sure what the issue is
between Youth A and Staff 1, but notices there is tension between
them. Staff 7 reported when Youth A is escalated, Staff 1 kind of
“pokes the bear”. Staff 7 reported one day she was assigned to
Youth A, and he was upset. Staff 7 reported Staff 1 came around
to see what Youth A was doing and Staff 7 felt like Staff 1 was just
being nosey by coming around despite knowing Youth A doesn’t
like her presence. Staff 7 reported sometimes Staff 1 will say
things to Youth A like, “I’m here to do my job”, and leave it at that.
Staff 7 reported she’s never seen Staff 1 outwardly bully Youth A,
laugh at him, stick her tongue out at him or say anything
10

inappropriate to him like “I’m tired of you”. Staff 7 reported when
Youth A is in a bad mood, Staff 1 will talk louder, but Staff 7 wasn’t
sure Staff 1’s intention behind it and could not provide any
examples of things Staff 1’s said louder in Youth A’s presence.
Staff 7 reported she informed Youth A if he feels uncomfortable,
feels like a staff is bullying him, or anything else, he is allowed to
make a report about it and staff can assist him.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• Incident report dated 1/18/25 authored by Program
Manager was written due to endangerment to staff by
youth. [Youth A] entered an agency van. [Staff 1], [Staff 5],
and [Staff 7] were in the van, and they all heard [Youth A]
threatening [Staff 1]. [Youth A] swore and reported he was
“going to do something to [Staff 1] at the end of the day” or
“something was going to happen to [Staff 1] at the end of
the day. [Staff 1] reported the threat to Supervisor.
Supervisor informed [Youth A] he is unable to threaten staff
and threats are taken seriously. [Youth A] has a history of
making facial gestures and some aggression towards [Staff
1]. [Staff 1] will not be included in the rotation to work with
[Youth A] for the time being.
• Staff Code of Conduct states staff will not engage in or
permit discriminatory treatment or harassment of anyone,
especially children, for any reason.
• Staff Conduct and Expectations Policy states staff are
expected to observe standards of professionalism, honesty,
and responsible behavior. They are expected to
demonstrate common courtesy and be positive role models
to youth served. Staff are expected to be positive role
models for the youth. Staff shall always show youth mutual
respect and model appropriate behavior.
• Staff 1 does not have any disciplinary actions in her
employee file. Staff 1 was trained on the Code of Conduct
on 2/29/24, 2/28/24, 5/20/24, 8/3/24, 10/12/24, 12/26/24
and 1/24/25.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as per interviews conducted,
and documentation reviewed, there is not enough information to
determine Staff 1 is targeting Youth A, provoking Youth A, or
treating Youth A poorly.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
11

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
